intro: Triumfetta welwitschii var. welwitschii, commonly known as the Welwitschii triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant has small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, round fruits. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments with minimal water availability.
